page.title: 04ECOLOGY:HABITAT.HOLT.WORCS.
page.content: {A.AQUATIC.1.Flowing}-River Severn constant depth of 9ft,so limited diversity of wild life. Shrawley Brook fast flowing. Grimley Brook-clay stream.{2.Static:}Turn Mill pond. Flooded worked-out gravel pits. Numerical decrease in other ponds due to changes in agriculture. {B.MARSH.}in riparian situations less than 5 acres support rich flora. {C.Terrestrial 1.Woodlands}Ancient woods of Monk Wood and Holt Mill Coppice are of special interest. Small wood above weir rich in wild life.{ {2.Grasslands-}About 10 fields in Shrawley Brook valley have escaped agricutural improvement and support rich flora.{3.Hedges and grass verges} 20% loss in Worcestershire reflected in this area.
